To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

202.description: Accepted. The request was accepted and dataset creation is in progress.

get.description:
**Note**: This API supports only Push datasets.

**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

put.description:
**Note**: This API supports only Push datasets.

**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

parameters.name: requestMessage
parameters.description: Table name and columns to update existing table

post.summary: Adds new data rows to the specified table within the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
post.description:
**Note**: This API supports only Push datasets.

**REST API Limitations:** See [Power BI REST API limitations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn950053.aspx).

**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

delete.summary: Deletes all rows from the specified table within the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
delete.description:
**Note**: this API supports only Push datasets.

**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

get.summary: Returns the refresh history of the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
get.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The requested number of entries in the refresh history. If not provided, the default is all available entries.

post.summary: Triggers a refresh for the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
post.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

get.summary: Returns a list of parameters for the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
get.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary: Updates the parameters values for the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
post.description:
**Important**: The dataset must be refreshed for new parameters values to be applied. Wait 30 minutes for the update parameters operation to complete before refreshing.

**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

Restrictions

  • All parameters must exist in the dataset. Names are case-sensitive.
  • Datasets with SQL, Oracle, Teradata & SapHana Direct Query connections are not supported.
  • Datasets with Analysis Services Live connections are not supported.
  • Maximum of a 100 parameters in request is allowed.
  • Values should be of expected Type.
  • Cannot pass empty value to an IsRequired parameter.
  • List cannot be empty or include multiple occurrences of same parameter.
  • Parameters of types 'Any' or 'Binary' cannot be set.

get.summary: Returns a list of datasources for the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
get.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary: Updates the datasources of the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
post.description:
**Important**:
  • The original datasource and the new datasource must have the exact same schema.
  • For cached models, the dataset must be refreshed to get the data from the new data sources. Wait 30 minutes for the update datasources operation to complete before refreshing.


**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

Restrictions

  • Update datasources supports SQL Server, Azure SQL Server, Analysis Services, Azure Analysis Services, OData Feed, and SharePoint datasources. For other datasource types, use [Update Parameters](/rest/api/power-bi/datasets/updateparameters)
  • Changing datasource type is not supported.
  • Datasources that contain parameters on the connection string are not supported.
  • Datasources which are part of Merged or Joined tables are not supported.

post.summary: Updates all connections for the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
post.description:
**Note**:
  • To update connection details for SQL, AS, OData Feed, and SharePoint, use [Update Datasources](/rest/api/power-bi/datasets/updatedatasources). For other datasource types, use [Update Parameters](/rest/api/power-bi/datasets/updateparameters).
  • This API only supports SQL DirectQuery datasets.


**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary: Binds the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"** to the specified gateway. This only supports the On-Premises Data Gateway.
post.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

get.summary: Returns a list of gateway datasources for the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"**.
get.description:
**Note**: Use the new [Dataset - Get Datasources](/rest/api/power-bi/datasets/getdatasources) API instead.

**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

get.summary: Returns a list of gateways which the specified dataset from **"My Workspace"** can be bound to.
get.description:
This API is relevant only for datasets that have at least one on-premises connection.
For datasets with cloud-only connections, it will return an empty list.

**Required scope**: Dataset.Read.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

get.summary: Returns a list of imports from **"My Workspace"**.
get.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary: Creates new content on **"My Workspace"** from .pbix, Excel or file path in OneDrive for Business.
post.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

Notes

  • To import a file, request Headers should include **Content-Type: multipart/form-data** with the file [encoded as form data](https://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html) in the request body.
  • To import from OneDrive for Business, request Headers should include **Content-Type: application/json** with [ImportInfo](/rest/api/power-bi/imports/postimport#importinfo) in the request body.
  • To import .pbix files larger than 1 GB, see [Create Temporary Upload Location](/rest/api/power-bi/imports/createtemporaryuploadlocation), suported only for workspaces on premium capacity.

parameters.name: datasetDisplayName
parameters.description: The display name of the dataset, should include file extension. Not supported when importing from OneDrive for Business.

parameters.name: nameConflict
parameters.description: Determines what to do if a dataset with the same name already exists. Default value is 'Ignore'.

values.description: If dataset with the same name already exists, Import operation will create a new dataset with the same name.
If dataset with the same name already exists, Import operation will be aborted.

If dataset with the same name already exists, Import operation will replace the existing dataset with the new one.
Import operation will fail if there is no conflict or if there are more than one datasets with the same name.

If dataset with the same name already exists, Import operation will replace the existing dataset with the new one.
Import operation will fail if there are more than one datasets with the same name.

get.summary: Returns the specified import from **"My Workspace"**.
get.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary: Creates a temporary blob storage to be used to import .pbix files larger than 1 GB.
post.description:
To import .pbix files larger than 1 GB, create a temporary upload location and upload the file using the shared access signature (SAS) url from the response, and then call [Post Import](/rest/api/power-bi/imports/postimport) and specify 'fileUrl' to be the SAS url in the [Request Body](/rest/api/power-bi/imports/postimport#request-body)

**Note**: Import large .pbix files is only available for workspaces on premium capacity.

**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary: Clones the specified tile from **"My Workspace"**.
post.description:
If target report id and target dataset are not specified, the following can occur:
  • When a tile clone is performed within the same workspace, the report and dataset links will be cloned from the source tile.
  • When cloning a tile within a different workspace, report and dataset links will be rested, and the tile will be broken.

    • **Required scope**: Dashboard.ReadWrite.All
    To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary: This functionality is only available in a workspace context. Use [Reports GenerateTokenForCreateInGroup](/rest/api/power-bi/embedtoken/reports_generatetokenforcreateingroup).

post.summary:
Generates an embed token to allow report creation on the specified workspace based on the specified dataset.
This API is relevant only to ['App owns data' embed scenario](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/embed-sample-for-customers).
post.description:
**Required scope**: (all of the below)
  • Content.Create
  • Report.ReadWrite.All or Report.Read.All
  • Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All

To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary:
Generates an embed token to view or edit the specified report from the specified workspace.
This API is relevant only to ['App owns data' embed scenario](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/embed-sample-for-customers).
post.description:
**Required scope**: (all of the below)
  • Report.ReadWrite.All or Report.Read.All
  • Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All
  • Content.Create - required only if allowSaveAs specified in [GenerateTokenRequest](/rest/api/power-bi/embedtoken/reports_generatetokeningroup#GenerateTokenRequest)

To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary:

post.description:
**Required scope**: Dataset.ReadWrite.All or Dataset.Read.All

post.summary:

**Required scope**: (all of the below)

post.summary: Assigns **"My Workspace"** to the specified capacity.
post.description:
**Note**: To perform this operation, the user must have admin or assign permissions on the capacity. To unassign **"My Workspace"** from a capacity, Empty Guid (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000) should be provided as capacityId.

**Required scope**: Capacity.ReadWrite.All and Workspace.ReadWrite.All.
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

post.summary: Assigns the specified workspace to the specified capacity.
post.description:
**Note**: To perform this operation, the user must be admin on the specified workspace and have admin or assign permissions on the capacity. To unassign the specified workspace from a capacity, Empty Guid (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000) should be provided as capacityId.

**Required scope**: Capacity.ReadWrite.All and Workspace.ReadWrite.All.
To set the permissions scope, see [Register an app](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/register-app).

reports.description: The reports associated with this import

datasets.description: The datasets associated with this import

filePath.description: The OneDrive for Business file path to import, can be absolute or relative

connectionType.description: The import connection type for OneDrive for Business file

fileUrl.description: The shared access signature (SAS) url of the temporary blob storage, used to import .pbix files larger than 1 GB.

defaultRetentionPolicy.description: The dataset default data retention policy. Only relevant to the PostDataset API.

addRowsAPIEnabled.description: Whether dataset allows adding new rows

tables.description: The dataset tables. Only relevant to the PostDataset API.

relationships.description: The dataset relationships. Only relevant to the PostDataset API.

datasources.description: The datasources associated with this dataset. Only relevant to the PostDataset API.

defaultMode.description: The dataset mode or type. Only relevant to the PostDataset API.

values.description: Creates a dataset with a live connection to Azure Analysis Service
Creates a dataset with a live connection to On-premise Analysis Service
Creates a dataset which allows programmatic access for pushing data into PowerBI, [learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/walkthrough-push-data)
Creates a dataset which supports data streaming, [learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-real-time-streaming)
Creates a dataset which supports data streaming and allows programmatic access for pushing data into Power BI

IsOnPremGatewayRequired.description: Dataset requires an On-premises Data Gateway

columns.description: The column schema for this table

rows.description: The data rows within this table

Relationship.description: A relationship between tables in a dataset

crossFilteringBehavior.description: The filter direction of the relationship

values.description: For filtering purposes, filter will be applied on the table where values are being aggregated
For filtering purposes, both tables are treated as if they're a single table
Cross filtering behavior defined automatically

fromTable.description: The name of the foreign key table

fromColumn.description: The name of the foreign key column

toTable.description: The name of the primary key table

toColumn.description: The name of the primary key column

name.description: The datasource name. Available only for DirectQuery.

connectionString.description: The datasource connection string. Available only for DirectQuery.

gatewayId.description: The bound gateway id. Empty when not bound to a gateway.

datasourceId.description: The bound datasource id. Empty when not bound to a gateway.

DatasourceConnectionDetails.description: A Power BI datasource connection details

Row.description: A data row in a dataset

ODataResponse[List[Table]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI table collection

ODataResponse[List[GatewayDatasource]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI gateway datasource collection

id.description: The unique id for this datasource

username.description: Username required to access the datasource

password.description: Password required to access the datasource

ODataResponse[List[Datasource]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI datasource collection

ODataResponse[List[Report]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI report collection

ODataResponse[List[Dashboard]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI dashboard collection

ODataResponse[List[Tile]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI tile collection

ODataResponse[List[Import]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI import collection

ODataResponse[List[Group]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI group list

ODataResponse[List[Gateway]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI gateways list

ODataResponse[List[Refresh]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI refresh history

ODataResponse[List[UserAccessRight]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI user access right for datasource List

value.description: The user access right for datasource List

ODataResponse[List[GroupUserAccessRight].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI user access right for group List

value.description: The user access right for group List

rowSpan.description: number of rows a tile should span

colSpan.description: number of columns a tile should span

reportId.description: The report id. Available only for tiles created from a report.

datasetId.description: The dataset id. Available only for tiles created from a report or using a dataset; for example, Q&A tiles.

isOnDedicatedCapacity.description: Is the group on dedicated capacity

users.description: The users that belong to the group, and their access rights.

GatewayPublicKey.description: A Power BI gateway public key

PublishDatasourceToGatewayRequest.description: A publish datasource to gateway request

credentials.description: The credentials. Depends on the 'credentialType' value. See [Update Datasource Examples](/rest/api/power-bi/gateways/updatedatasource#examples).

encryptedConnection.description: Should Power BI allow fallback to unencrypted if the target server doesn't support encryption

encryptionAlgorithm.description: The encryption algorithm. For cloud datasource, use 'None'. For on-premises datasource, use gateway public key with 'RSA-OAEP' algorithm.

privacyLevel.description: The privacy level. Relevant when combining data from multiple sources.

useCallerAADIdentity.description: Should the caller's AAD identity be used for OAuth2 credentials configuration

useEndUserOAuth2Credentials.description: Should the end-user OAuth2 credentials be used for connecting to the datasource in DirectQuery mode. Only supported for Direct Query to SQL Azure.

UpdateDatasourceRequest.description: An update datasource to gateway request

BindToGatewayRequest.description: The bind dataset to gateway request

Refresh.description: A Power BI refresh history entry

values.description: Refresh was triggered by the dataset refresh schedule setting
Refresh was triggered interactively threw Power BI portal
Refresh was triggered by an Api call

endTime.description: DateTime of termination (may be empty if refresh is progress)

serviceExceptionJson.description: Failure exception details in json format. Includes cluster, time, Request, and Activity IDs (only on error).

status.description:
'Unknown' - Unknown completion state or refresh is in progress. endTime will be empty with this status.
'Completed' - refresh completed successfully
'Failed' - Refresh failed. serviceExceptionJson will contain the error.
'Disabled' - Refresh disabled by Selective Refresh.

notifyOption.description: Mail notification options (success and/or failure, or none)

values.description: No notification will be sent
Mail notification will be sent on refresh failure
Mail notification will be sent on refresh completion, including either failure and success

UpdateDatasetParameterDetails.description: Power BI dataset parameter update details

UpdateDatasetParametersRequest.description: Power BI dataset parameter update request

updateDetails.description: The dataset parameter list to update

ODataResponse[List[DatasetParameter]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI dataset parameter list

UserAccessRight.description: A Power BI user access right entry for datasource

datasourceAccessRight.description:
The user access rights for the datasource.
Only Read permission is supported.

values.description: Removes permission to access the datasource. Only applies when updating user permissions.
Indicates that datasets owned by the user has read access to this datasource.
Not Supported
Not Supported
Not Supported

GroupUserAccessRight.description: A Power BI user access right entry for workspace

groupUserAccessRight.description: Access rights user has for the workspace

values.description: Removes permission to content in workspace
Grants read access to content in workspace
Grants administrator rights to workspace
Grants read and write access to content in group
User principal type
Group principal type

targetWorkspaceId.description:
Optional parameter for specifying the target workspace id. Empty Guid (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000) indicates 'My Workspace'.
If not provided, the new report will be cloned within the same workspace as the source report.

targetModelId.description:
Optional parameter for specifying the target associated dataset id.
If not provided, the new report will be associated with the same dataset as the source report.

datasetId.description: The new dataset of the rebinded report

GroupCreationRequest.description: Power BI create a new group request

name.description: The name of the newly created group

GroupRestoreRequest.description: Power BI request to restore a deleted group

name.description: The name of the group to be restored.

emailAddress.description: The email address of the owner of the group to be restored.

EffectiveIdentity.description: The identity the generated token should reflect, for more details see this [article](https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/embedded-row-level-security)

username.description: The effective username reflected by a token for applying RLS rules (For OnPrem model, username can be composed of alpha-numerical characters or any of the following characters  '.', '-', '_', '!', '#', '^', '~', '\\', '@', also username cannot contain spaces. For Cloud model, username can be composed of all ASCII characters. username must be up to 256 characters)

roles.description: An array of roles reflected by a token when applying RLS rules (identity can contain up to 50 roles, role can be composed of any character besides ',' and must be up to 50 characters)

datasets.description: An array of datasets for which this identity applies

customData.description: The value of customdata to be used for applying RLS rules. Only supported for live connections to Azure Analysis Services.

accessLevel.description: Required access level for EmbedToken generation

values.description: Indicates that the generated EmbedToken should grant only Viewing permissions
Indicates that the generated EmbedToken should grant Viewing and Editing permissions, only applies when generating EmbedToken for report embedding
Indicates that the generated EmbedToken should grant Creation permissions, only applies when generating EmbedToken for report creation

datasetId.description: Dataset id for report creation. Only applies when generating EmbedToken for report creation.

allowSaveAs.description: Indicates an embedded report can be saved as a new report. Default value is 'false'. Only applies when generating EmbedToken for report embedding.

identities.description: List of identities to use for RLS rules. Specifying identities is not supported when generating EmbedToken for dataset embedding.

tokenId.description: Unique token Id. Can be used to correlate operations that use this token with the generate operation through audit logs.

expiration.description: Expiration time of token. In UTC.

targetWorkspaceId.description:
Optional parameter for specifying the target workspace id. Empty Guid (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000) indicates 'My Workspace'.
If not provided, tile will be cloned within the same workspace as the source tile.

targetReportId.description:
Optional parameter
When cloning a tile linked to a report, pass the target report id to rebind the new tile to a different report.

targetModelId.description:
Optional parameter
When cloning a tile linked to a dataset, pass the target model id to rebind the new tile to a different dataset.

positionConflictAction.description:
Optional parameter for specifying the action in case of position conflict.
If not provided, 'Tail' is used.
If there is no conflict, clone tile to same position as in source.

values.description: Tile will be added at the end of the chosen dashboard
In a case of position conflict, the request will be aborted

name.description: The name of the new dashboard

UpdateReportContentRequest.description: Power BI update report content request

sourceType.description: The source type for the content update

values.description: Not Supported
Capacity ready for use
Capacity in activation process
Capacity failed to provisioned
Capacity suspended for use
Not Supported
Capacity in process of being deleted
Capacity has been deleted and is not available
Capacity can not be used
Capacity Sku change is in progress

capacityUserAccessRight.description: Access right user has on the capacity

values.description: User doesn't have access to the capacity
User can assign workspaces to the capacity
User has administrator rights on the capacity

region.description: The Azure region where the capacity is provisioned

ODataResponse[List[Capacity]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI capacity list

ODataResponse[List[AvailableFeature]].description: Odata response wrapper for a Power BI available features list

Usage.description: The token generation usage (in %) from the limitation on shared capacity

AssignToCapacityRequest.description: Power BI assign to capacity request

capacityId.description: The capacity id. To unassign from capacity, use Empty Guid (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000).

TemporaryUploadLocation.description: Power BI update report content request

Url.description: The shared access signature (SAS) url for the temporary blob storage

ExpirationTime.description: The expiration time of the shared access signature (SAS) url
